definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of

sentences.english: Having data sets with a non-white space character separating the data points is a very common occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 最常見的就是數據集合不使用空格字符分隔數據點。

sentences.english: The value passed to the actions should be comma-delimited lists of values.
sentences.chinese: 傳遞給動作的值應該是以逗號分隔的值列表。

sentences.english: They're evenly spaced in this model.
sentences.chinese: 它們均等地分隔在這個模型中。

sentences.english: Partition is for disjunctive space and of generation.
sentences.chinese: 隔斷是爲了分隔空間而產生的。

sentences.english: It is this love that knows no separation. To it, far is near.
sentences.chinese: 此愛不可分隔，視天涯如咫尺。

sentences.english: Multiple decimal separators result in truncation.
sentences.chinese: 多個小數分隔符會導致截斷。

sentences.english: Most of the time this will apply to cutting up visual designs or helping troubleshoot a bug.
sentences.chinese: 大部分時間都用來分隔視覺設計或幫助排除故障。

sentences.english: All other languages support the period-separated format.
sentences.chinese: 其他所有語言都支援句號分隔的格式。

sentences.english: Duties for network and security controls of virtual machines may not be well separated.
sentences.chinese: 對虛擬機的網絡和安全控制職責可能沒有很好地分隔。

sentences.english: Yellow lines divide the field into sections.
sentences.chinese: 幾道黃線把場地分隔成幾部分。

sentences.english: The Berlin Wall symbolized a world divided and it defined an entire era.
sentences.chinese: 柏林牆象徵着一個分隔的世界，代表一個時代。

sentences.english: Also can make gain in addition ancient frame come disjunctive space.
sentences.chinese: 此外也可製作博古架來分隔空間。

sentences.english: The Atlantic Ocean separates America from Europe.
sentences.chinese: 大西洋把美洲和歐洲分隔開來。

sentences.english: No delimiters are required to separate each propagation from the next.
sentences.chinese: 不需要分隔符將每次傳播與下一次傳播分離。

sentences.english: This means the delimiter is added after each record that is written.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着在所寫入的每個記錄後面添加分隔符。

sentences.english: A comma-separated value is the default configuration for the delimited data handler.
sentences.chinese: 逗號分隔值是帶分隔符的數據處理程序的缺省配置。

definition: partition/to stand between/wall or fence serving as partition
to overlap/to superimpose/to telescope/to run together/to duplicate/one over another/superposition/an overlap/redundancy/reduplication (in Chinese grammar, e.g. 散散步[san4 san4 bu4] to have a stroll)
to seal/to close/to confine/to seal off/to close down/sealed/confined/closed/unreceptive
one divides into two/to be two-sided/there are two sides to everything/to see both sb's good points and shortcomings (idiom)
